constructorProps.name: multiple
constructorProps.description: If `true`, the user can select multiple items.

constructorProps.name: selected
constructorProps.description:
The currently selected item(s).
If `multiple` is `true`, this should be an `Iterable`.
Otherwise, it'll be a `string`.

constructorProps.name: onSelectedChange
constructorProps.type:
| ((value: Multiple extends true ? Set<string> : string | undefined) => void)
  | undefined
constructorProps.description: Callback fired when selection changes

constructorProps.name: expanded
constructorProps.description: The currently expanded items

constructorProps.name: onExpandedChange
constructorProps.description: Callback fired when expanded state changes

constructorProps.name: expandOnClick
constructorProps.description: If `true`, groups (items with children) expand on click.

constructorProps.name: items
constructorProps.description: The items contained in the tree.

constructorProps.name: typeaheadTimeout
constructorProps.description: How many time (in ms) the typeahead string is held before it is cleared

methods.name: isSelected
methods.description: Checks if an item is currently selected@param id - ID of the item to check

methods.name: isExpanded
methods.description: Checks if an item is currently expanded@param id - ID of the item to check

methods.name: expand
methods.description: Expands a specific item@param id - ID of the item to expand

methods.name: collapse
methods.description: Collapses a specific item@param id - ID of the item to collapse

methods.name: toggleExpand
methods.description: Toggles the expanded state of an item@param id - ID of the item to toggle

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects a specific item@param id - ID of the item to select

methods.name: deselect
methods.description: Deselects a specific item@param id - ID of the item to deselect

methods.name: toggleSelect
methods.description: Toggles the selected state of an item@param id - ID of the item to toggle

methods.name: selectAll
methods.description: Selects all visible items.If all items are already selected, clears the selection.

methods.name: getItemId
methods.description: Gets the DOM ID for a specific tree item@param id - ID of the item

methods.name: getItemEl
methods.description: Gets the DOM element for a specific tree item@param id - ID of the item

methods.name: selectUntil
methods.description: Selects all items between the last selected item and the specified item@param id - ID of the item to select until

properties.name: items
properties.description: The items contained in the tree

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: If `true`, the user can select multiple items holding `Control`/`Meta` or `Shift`

properties.name: expandOnClick
properties.description: If `true`, groups (items with children) expand on click

properties.name: selected
properties.type: Multiple extends true ? Set<string> : string | undefined
properties.description: Currently selected item(s)For multiple selection, returns a Set of IDsFor single selection, returns a single ID or undefined

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Set of currently expanded item IDs

properties.name: root
properties.description: Gets ARIA attributes for the root tree element

properties.name: group
properties.description: ARIA attributes for group elements

properties.name: children
properties.description: Array of Child instances representing the top-level items

constructorProps.name: value
constructorProps.description:
The value for the Toggle.

When passing a getter, it will be used as source of truth,
meaning that the value only changes when the getter returns a new value.

Otherwise, if passing a static value, it'll serve as the default value.

constructorProps.name: onValueChange
constructorProps.description: Called when the value is supposed to change.

constructorProps.name: disabled
constructorProps.description: If `true`, prevents the user from interacting with the input.

properties.name: trigger
properties.description: The trigger that toggles the value.

properties.name: hiddenInput
properties.description: A hidden input field to use within forms.

constructorProps.name: selectWhenFocused
constructorProps.description: If `true`, the value will be changed whenever a trigger is focused.

constructorProps.name: loop
constructorProps.description: If the the trigger selection should loop when navigating with the arrow keys.

constructorProps.name: orientation
constructorProps.description: The orientation of the tabs.

constructorProps.name: value
constructorProps.description:
The default value for `tabs.value`

When passing a getter, it will be used as source of truth,
meaning that `tabs.value` only changes when the getter returns a new value.

If omitted, it will use the first tab as default.

constructorProps.name: onValueChange
constructorProps.description: Called when the `Tabs` instance tries to change the active tab.

methods.name: getTrigger
methods.type:
(value: T) => {
  readonly "data-melt-tabs-trigger": T
  readonly "data-active": "" | undefined
  readonly tabindex: 0 | -1
  readonly role: "tab"
  readonly "aria-selected": boolean
  readonly "aria-controls": string
  readonly "data-orientation": "horizontal" | "vertical"
  readonly onclick: () => T
  readonly onkeydown: (e: KeyboardEvent) => void
  readonly id: string
}
methods.description: Gets the attributes and listeners for a tab trigger. Requires an identifying tab value.

methods.name: getContent
methods.type:
(value: T) => {
  readonly "data-melt-tabs-content": ""
  readonly hidden: boolean
  readonly "data-active": "" | undefined
  readonly role: "tabpanel"
  readonly id: string
  readonly "aria-labelledby": string
  readonly "data-orientation": "horizontal" | "vertical"
}
methods.description: Gets the attributes and listeners for the tabs contents. Requires an identifying tab value.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The current selected tab.

properties.name: triggerList
properties.description: The attributes for the list that contains the tab triggers.

constructorProps.name: min
constructorProps.description: The minimum value of the slider.

constructorProps.name: max
constructorProps.description: The maximum value of the slider.

constructorProps.name: orientation
constructorProps.description: The orientation of the slider.

constructorProps.name: step
constructorProps.description: The step size of the slider.

constructorProps.name: value
constructorProps.description:
The default value.

When passing a getter, it will be used as source of truth,
meaning that `value` only changes when the getter returns a new value.

constructorProps.name: dir
constructorProps.description:
The direction of the slider.

For vertical sliders, setting `dir` to `rtl`
causes the slider to start from the top.

constructorProps.name: autoSort
constructorProps.description: Determines if the values array should be automatically sorted.

constructorProps.name: onValueChange
constructorProps.description: Called when the `Slider` instance value changes.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the slider.

properties.name: root
properties.description: The root of the slider.Any cursor interaction along this element will change the slider's values.

constructorProps.name: min
constructorProps.description: The minimum value of the slider.

constructorProps.name: max
constructorProps.description: The maximum value of the slider.

constructorProps.name: orientation
constructorProps.description: The orientation of the slider.

constructorProps.name: step
constructorProps.description: The step size of the slider.

constructorProps.name: value
constructorProps.description:
The default value for `tabs.value`

When passing a getter, it will be used as source of truth,
meaning that `tabs.value` only changes when the getter returns a new value.

If omitted, it will use the first tab as default.

constructorProps.name: onValueChange
constructorProps.description: Called when the `Slider` instance tries to change the active tab.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the slider.

properties.name: root
properties.type:
{
  readonly "data-dragging": "" | undefined
  readonly "data-value": number
  readonly "data-orientation": "horizontal" | "vertical"
  readonly "aria-valuenow": number
  readonly "aria-valuemin": number
  readonly "aria-valuemax": number
  readonly "aria-orientation": "horizontal" | "vertical"
  readonly style: `--percentage: ${string}; --percentage-inv: ${string}; touch-action: ${string}`
  readonly tabindex: 0
  readonly role: "slider"
  readonly "data-melt-slider-root": ""
  readonly id: string
  readonly onpointerdown: (e: PointerEvent) => void
  readonly onkeydown: (e: KeyboardEvent) => void
}
properties.description: The root of the slider.Any cursor interaction along this element will change the slider's values.

properties.name: thumb
properties.type:
{
  readonly "data-dragging": "" | undefined
  readonly "data-value": number
  readonly "data-orientation": "horizontal" | "vertical"
  readonly "data-melt-slider-thumb": ""
  readonly tabindex: 0
}
properties.description: The slider's thumb, positioned at the end of the range.

constructorProps.name: open
constructorProps.description:
If the Popover is open.

When passing a getter, it will be used as source of truth,
meaning that the value only changes when the getter returns a new value.

Otherwise, if passing a static value, it'll serve as the default value.

constructorProps.name: onOpenChange
constructorProps.description: Called when the value is supposed to change.

constructorProps.name: forceVisible
constructorProps.description: If the popover visibility should be controlled by the user.

constructorProps.name: computePositionOptions
constructorProps.description: Options to be passed to Floating UI's `computePosition`

properties.name: trigger
properties.type:
{
  readonly onfocusout: () => Promise<void>
  readonly "data-melt-popover-trigger": ""
  readonly id: string
  readonly popovertarget: string
  readonly onclick: (e: Event) => void
}
properties.description: The trigger that toggles the value.

properties.name: content
properties.type:
{
  readonly onfocusout: () => Promise<void>
  readonly "data-melt-popover-content": ""
  readonly id: string
  readonly popover: "manual"
  readonly ontoggle: (
    e: ToggleEvent & { currentTarget: EventTarget & HTMLElement },
  ) => void
  readonly tabindex: -1
  readonly inert: boolean
  readonly "data-open": "" | undefined
}

constructorProps.name: value
constructorProps.description:
The value for the Pin Input.

When passing a getter, it will be used as source of truth,
meaning that the value only changes when the getter returns a new value.

Otherwise, if passing a static value, it'll serve as the default value.

constructorProps.name: onValueChange
constructorProps.description: Called when the `PinInput` instance tries to change the value.

constructorProps.name: maxLength
constructorProps.description: The amount of digits in the Pin Input.

constructorProps.name: placeholder
constructorProps.description: An optional placeholder to display when the input is empty.

constructorProps.name: disabled
constructorProps.description: If `true`, prevents the user from interacting with the input.

constructorProps.name: mask
constructorProps.description: If the input should be masked like a password.

constructorProps.name: type
constructorProps.description: What characters the input accepts.

properties.name: root
properties.description: The root element's props.

properties.name: inputs
properties.type:
{
  readonly "data-melt-pin-input-input": ""
  readonly placeholder: string | undefined
  readonly disabled: true | undefined
  readonly type: "text" | "password"
  readonly "data-filled": "" | undefined
  readonly tabindex: 0 | -1
  readonly style: "caret-color: transparent;" | undefined
  readonly onkeydown: (e: KeyboardEvent) => void
  readonly onpointerdown: (e: Event) => void
  readonly onpointerup: (e: Event) => void
  readonly oninput: (e: Event) => void
  readonly onfocus: () => void
  readonly onblur: () => void
}[]
properties.description: An array of props that should be spread to the input elements.
